intro: Homalium anzoateguiense, commonly known as the Anzoategui holly, is a species of flowering plant in the family Euphorbiaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Venezuela and Colombia. The plant is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
